General.text:
Type: Beta lactamase resistant
penicillins
Dosage Forms: 125mg/5 ml oral powder, 250mg, 500mg
Common Trade Names: Cloxapen, Dry Clox, Tegopen

Pneumonia.text: 500mg PO q6hrs for up to 21 days

Soft_tissue/skin_infection.text: 500mg PO q6hrs for 7 days or until 3 days after acute inflammation resolves

Upper_Respiratory_Tract_Infection_2.text: >=1 yr to 18 yrs: 50-100mg/kg/day orally divided every 6 hrs, Max dose 4g/day

Soft_tissue_and_skin_infection.text: >=1 yr to 18 yrs: 50-100mg/kg/day orally divided every 6 hrs, Max dose 4g/day

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: Pregnancy Category B
Lactation: acceptable to use during breastfeeding
Renal Dosing: no adjustments needed
Hepatic Dosing: no adjustments needed

Serious.text:
allergic reaction
seizures
pseudomembranous colitis
neutropenia
leukopenia
thrombocytopenia
cholestatic hepatitis
hypersensitivity reaction

Common.text:
nausea, vomiting
diarrhea, abdominal pain
thrush/yeast infection

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 30 min - 1 hr
Metabolism: partially metabolized
Excretion: renal and biliary
Mechanism of Action: bactericidal; adheres to penicillin-binding proteins inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis
